column2: WYOMING DMV TEST
column4: Wyoming
column6: WY

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column4: a stop sign.
column6: a yield sign.
column8: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 2. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: You.
column6: The other driver.

column2: 3. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column6: The bus is about to stop.
column8: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.

column2: 4. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column6: Yes, always.

column2: 5. A broken yellow line on your side of the roadway only means:
column4: Passing is permitted on both sides.
column6: Passing is permitted on your side of the roadway.
column8: Passing is not permitted on either side.

column2: 6. When changing lanes:
column4: slow down and check your left mirror.
column6: change lane before checking the inside rearview mirror.
column8: look over your shoulder to make sure no one is in the blind spot.

column2: 7. What does BAC stand for?
column4: Blood Alcohol Concentration
column6: Blood Alcohol Content

column2: 8. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column4: diamond shaped.
column6: rectangle shaped.

column2: 9. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
column4: stop
column6: yield

column2: 10. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column4: red, green and yellow
column6: red, yellow and green

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp curve ahead
column6: Right turn permitted

column2: 12. If a tire suddenly goes flat while you are driving, you should:
column4: pump the brake pedal 5-7 times until the vehicle stops.
column6: slow down gradually do not apply the brake.
column8: apply the brake firmly and stop.

column2: 13. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the right.
column6: slow down and keep well to the left.
column8: increase their speed and keep well to the right.

column2: 14. Large trucks:
column4: are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.
column6: have high-tech air brakes which allow them to stop quickly.
column8: take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.

column2: 15. When you are angry or upset you should:
column4: take a few minutes to cool off before you drive.
column6: drive fast to let off steam.
column8: listen to loud music while driving.

column2: 16. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 17. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: there is a double curve ahead.
column8: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.

column2: 18. When in a vehicle, wear a seat belt:
column4: at all times.
column6: on long trips.

column2: 19. Which of the following is a common cause of traffic collisions?
column4: Driving too fast for conditions.
column6: Pedestrians being key participants in the transportation system.
column8: Scanning the road ahead and staying focused on the driving task.

column2: 20. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column6: The light will soon change from green to red.

column2: 21. There is no crosswalk and a pedestrian is crossing your lane ahead. You should:
column4: slow down as you pass the pedestrian.
column6: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.
column8: make eye contact and then pass the pedestrian.

column2: 22. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column4: defensive driving
column6: road rage

column2: 23. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column6: Apply the parking brake slowly.

column2: 24. Roads are the most slippery:
column4: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.
column6: the first rain after a dry spell.
column8: after it has been raining for an hour or more.

column2: 25. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column4: A school crossing
column6: Yield

column2: 26. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.

column2: 27. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must turn around immediately.
column6: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column8: they must not drive past this sign.

column2: 28. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 29. To avoid hydroplaning you should:
column4: slow down when roads are wet.
column6: keep your tires properly inflated.

column2: 30. When entering an expressway from the entrance ramp, you should:
column4: cross over to the traffic lane as soon as possible.
column6: go down to the bottom of the ramp and stop until it is safe to enter the expressway.
column8: use the acceleration lane to blend into the traffic.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column4: Highway entrance ramp ahead
column6: Left lane widens

column2: 32. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column6: to signal all lane changes.
column8: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.

column2: 33. When passing a motorcycle you must:
column4: give the motorcyclist the right hand part of his traffic lane.
column6: sound your horn to alert the motorcyclist.
column8: give the motorcyclist the entire traffic lane as if the motorcycle was a car.

column2: 34. __________________ is a safe driving technique.
column4: Using your high beam lights in the fog
column6: Checking your rearview mirrors frequently
column8: Starring at the road ahead of your vehicle

column2: 35. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: NO TURN ON RED.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 36. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.
column6: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column8: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp turn to the left
column6: Low shoulder

column2: 38. This sign means:
column4: U-turns are not allowed.
column6: No parking on pavement.

column2: 39. This road sign means the road you're driving on:
column4: turns only to the left
column6: turns sharply to the left and then right
column8: turns to the right and then the left

column2: 40. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column4: you must turn right.
column6: the road is narrower ahead.

column2: 41. Don't be afraid to sound a sharp blast on your horn when:
column4: another vehicle is in danger of hitting you.
column6: when a child is about to run into the street.

column2: 42. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column6: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.

column2: 43. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Leave the road immediately.
column6: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column8: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 44. When following another vehicle at night, drivers should use:
column4: emergency flashers.
column6: high beam headlights.

column2: 45. These are:
column4: miles-left signs.
column6: speed limit signs.

column2: 46. BAC is:
column4: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column6: the acronym for Beer ACcumulation.
column8: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 47. Drivers should change lanes:
column4: often.
column6: as quickly as possible.

column2: 48. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: relax and concentrate on driving.
column6: drive above the posted speed limit.
column8: tailgate the driver in front of you.

column2: 49. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop
column6: Slow down or stop
column8: Drive with caution and be ready to stop

column2: 50. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you increase the chance of a crash.
column6: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
